paragraphs: The management of railway transport in the Czech Republic invites everyone to free tours of the historical halls of the Fantova building at Prague's Main Train Station (Fantova budova Hlavního nádraží), where a large-scale reconstruction was completed at the end of 2023.
Excursions take place every Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday. Participation is free, but prior reservation is required via email at fantovabudova@spravazeleznic.cz.
In the reply letter, the organizers will provide the time and location of the meeting.
Кроме впечатляющих сводов посетители увидят потрясающие керамические мозаики 1903 года авторства чешского художника Яна Бенеша.
In the renovated two-story space of Foyer Café, a coffee shop will soon open.
It will be accessible to passengers from the central part of the station and the first platform.
The main Fantov hall will be available to the city residents in a limited mode - only within the framework of excursions, cultural, and public events.
In turn, the Column Hall is planned to be used as a business lounge area with a bar.
Let's note that the Fant Building in Art Nouveau style was built in 1901-1909. Until 1977, it served as the main building of the Main Railway Station.
It got its name from the Czech architect Josef Fanta, who was the author of the entire project.
